core_sources.documentation: Core plasma source terms (for the transport equations). Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux)

core_sources.code.documentation: Generic decription of the code-specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

core_sources.code.output_flag.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

core_sources.code.parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

core_sources.ids_properties.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

core_sources.ids_properties.comment.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

core_sources.ids_properties.creation_dat.documentation: Date at which this data has been produced

core_sources.ids_properties.homogeneous_.documentation: This node must be filled (with 0 or 1) for the IDS to be valid. If 1, the time of this IDS is homogeneous, i.e. the time values for this IDS are stored in the time node just below the root of this IDS. If 0, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree. In the case only constant or static nodes are filled within the IDS, this node must still be filled, and set to 1 (by convention).

core_sources.ids_properties.provider.documentation: Name of the person in charge of producing this data

core_sources.ids_properties.source.documentation: Source of the data (any comment describing the origin of the data : code, path to diagnostic signals, processing method, ...)

core_sources.source[:].global_quantities.documentation: Total source quantities integrated over the plasma volume or surface
Index in the error_description list for "current_parallel"
Index in the error_description list for "particles"
Index in the error_description list for "power"
Total power coupled to the plasma
Index in the error_description list for "power"
Index in the error_description list for "torque_tor"
Total power coupled to ion species (summed over ion  species)
Index in the error_description list for "total_ion_power"

core_sources.source[:].identifier.documentation: Source term identifier (process causing this source term)

core_sources.source[:].identifier.index.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list)

core_sources.source[:].profiles_1d.documentation: Source profiles for various time slices. Source terms are positive (resp. negative) when there is a gain (resp. a loss) to the considered channel.

core_sources.source[:].profiles_1d[:].co.documentation: Parallel conductivity due to this source
Index in the error_description list for "conductivity_parallel"

core_sources.source[:].profiles_1d[:].cu.documentation: Parallel current driven inside the flux surface. Cumulative surface integral of j_parallel
Index in the error_description list for "current_parallel_inside"

core_sources.source[:].profiles_1d[:].gr.documentation: Cross-sectional area of the flux surface
Index in the error_description list for "area"
Index in the error_description list for "psi"
Toroidal flux coordinate. rho_tor = sqrt(b_flux_tor/(pi*b0)) ~ sqrt(pi*r^2*b0/(pi*b0)) ~ r [m]. The toroidal field used in its definition is indicated under vacuum_toroidal_field/b0
Index in the error_description list for "rho_tor"

Normalised toroidal flux coordinate. The normalizing value for rho_tor_norm, is the toroidal flux coordinate at the equilibrium boundary (LCFS or 99.x % of the LCFS in case of a fixed boundary equilibium calculation, see time_slice/boundary/b_flux_pol_norm in the equilibrium IDS)
Index in the error_description list for "rho_tor_norm"
Volume enclosed inside the magnetic surface
Index in the error_description list for "volume"

core_sources.source[:].species.documentation: Species causing this source term (if relevant, e.g. a particular ion or neutral state in case of line radiation)

core_sources.source[:].species.ion.documentation: Description of the ion or neutral species, used if type/index = 2 or 3

core_sources.source[:].species.ion.eleme.documentation: List of elements forming the atom or molecule
Index in the error_description list for "a"
Number of atoms of this element in the molecule
Index in the error_description list for "multiplicity"
Index in the error_description list for "z_n"

core_sources.source[:].species.ion.label.documentation: String identifying ion (e.g. H+, D+, T+, He+2, C+, ...)

core_sources.source[:].species.ion.state.documentation: Quantities related to the different states of the species (ionisation, energy, excitation, ...)
Configuration of atomic orbitals of this state, e.g. 1s2-2s1
String identifying ion state (e.g. C+, C+2 , C+3, C+4, C+5, C+6, ...)
Index in the error_description list for "vibrational_level"
Vibrational mode of this state, e.g. "A_g". Need to define, or adopt a standard nomenclature.
Maximum Z of the charge state bundle (equal to z_min if no bundle)
Index in the error_description list for "z_max"
Minimum Z of the charge state bundle (z_min = z_max = 0 for a neutral)
Index in the error_description list for "z_min"

core_sources.source[:].species.ion.z_ion.documentation: Ion charge (of the dominant ionisation state; lumped ions are allowed)
Index in the error_description list for "z_ion"

core_sources.source[:].species.neutral.documentation: Description of the neutral species, used if type/index = 4 or 5

core_sources.source[:].species.neutral.e.documentation: List of elements forming the atom or molecule
Index in the error_description list for "a"
Number of atoms of this element in the molecule
Index in the error_description list for "multiplicity"
Index in the error_description list for "z_n"

core_sources.source[:].species.neutral.l.documentation: String identifying neutral (e.g. H, D, T, He, C, ...)

core_sources.source[:].species.neutral.s.documentation: Configuration of atomic orbitals of this state, e.g. 1s2-2s1
Neutral type, in terms of energy. ID =1: cold; 2: thermal; 3: fast; 4: NBI
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list)
Index in the error_description list for "vibrational_level"
Vibrational mode of this state, e.g. "A_g". Need to define, or adopt a standard nomenclature.

core_sources.source[:].species.type.documentation: Species type. index=1 for electron; index=2 for ion species in a single/average state (refer to ion structure); index=3 for ion species in a particular state (refer to ion/state structure);  index=4 for neutral species in a single/average state (refer to neutral structure); index=5 for neutral species in a particular state (refer to neutral/state structure);  index=6 for neutron; index=7 for photon

core_sources.source[:].species.type.inde.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list)

core_sources.vacuum_toroidal_field.documentation: Characteristics of the vacuum toroidal field (used in Rho_Tor definition and in the normalization of current densities)

core_sources.vacuum_toroidal_field.b0.documentation: Vacuum toroidal field at R0 [T]; Positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewing from above. The product R0B0 must be consistent with the b_tor_vacuum_r field of the tf IDS.

core_sources.vacuum_toroidal_field.b0_er.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "b0"

core_sources.vacuum_toroidal_field.r0.documentation: Reference major radius where the vacuum toroidal magnetic field is given (usually a fixed position such as the middle of the vessel at the equatorial midplane)

core_sources.vacuum_toroidal_field.r0_er.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "r0"
